text: Solve this problem step by step.
End with 'DONE.' when you have a solution.
Question: A man lives on the 10th floor of an apartment building.
Every morning he takes the elevator down to the ground floor to go to work.
When he returns in the evening, he takes the elevator to the 7th floor and walks up the stairs for the remaining three floors to reach his apartment.
However, on rainy days, he takes the elevator all the way to the 10th floor.

Why does he only take the elevator to the 7th floor on non-rainy days? 

 Solution: 
<think>
Okay, so I'm trying to figure out why this man takes the elevator only to the 7th floor on non-rainy days.
Let me break this down step by step.
First, he lives on the 10th floor.
Every morning, he takes the elevator down to the ground floor (which is the 1st floor, I assume) to go to work.
So, that's a trip from 10th to 1st floor each morning.
In the evening, when he returns, on non-rainy days, he takes the elevator to the 7th floor and then walks up the stairs for the remaining three floors to get to his apartment.
On rainy days, he takes the elevator all the way back up to the 10th floor.

Hmm, why wouldn't he just take the elevator all the way up on non-rainy days? Maybe there's something about the elevator's behavior or the building's structure that makes taking the elevator only to the 7th floor more efficient or practical.
Wait, perhaps the elevator doesn't go all the way up to the 10th floor in the evening unless it's raining.
Maybe the elevator has certain restrictions.

Like, maybe the elevator only goes up to the 7th floor in the evening, or perhaps the man is trying to save time or effort by walking up the stairs instead of waiting for the elevator to go all the way up.

But why would the elevator not go all the way up on non-rainy days? Maybe the elevator has a limit, or the man prefers not to wait for the elevator to go up 9 floors when he can just take it partway and walk the rest.
Or maybe the building's elevator system is designed so that it doesn't go beyond a certain floor in the evening unless it's raining.
Another angle: perhaps the man is trying to save time.
If he takes the elevator to the 7th floor, he only needs to walk up 3 floors, which is quicker than waiting for the elevator to come back down and then go all the way up.
On rainy days, maybe he prefers to stay dry by taking the elevator all the way up.
Alternatively, maybe the elevator only goes up to the 7th floor in the evening, regardless of the weather.
But the problem states that on rainy days, he takes the elevator all the way to the 10th floor.
So, perhaps on non-rainy days, the elevator doesn't go beyond the 7th floor in the evening, forcing him to walk up the stairs.
Wait, but why would the elevator's limit be different in the morning and evening? Maybe the elevator's direction is different.
In the morning, it goes down, so it can go all the way from 10th to 1st.
In the evening, perhaps it's programmed to only go up to the 7th floor unless it's raining, when it goes all the way up.
So, if that's the case, on non-rainy days, the elevator only takes him to the 7th floor, and he has to walk up the stairs because the elevator won't go further.
On rainy days, the elevator overrides that limit and takes him all the way up to the 10th floor.

Alternatively, maybe the man is trying to avoid using the elevator on non-rainy days to save money or because he prefers walking, but that doesn't make much sense because he takes the elevator in the morning every day.
So, it's more likely about the elevator's behavior.

So, putting it all together, the man takes the elevator to the 7th floor on non-rainy days because the elevator only goes up to that floor in the evening, unless it's raining, when it goes all the way up to the 10th floor.
Therefore, he doesn't need to wait for the elevator to go further on non-rainy days, and walking up the stairs is quicker or more convenient.

</think>

The man takes the elevator to the 7th floor on non-rainy days because the elevator's evening route is limited to the 7th floor unless it's raining.
On rainy days, the elevator goes all the way up to the 10th floor.
Therefore, on non-rainy days, after taking the elevator down in the morning, he uses the stairs to reach his apartment, as the elevator doesn't go further in the evening unless it's raining.
